ai_analysis.summary: Written amount contains clear spelling errors indicating tampering or counterfeit printing.
reasoning: Raw OCR text shows “FOUN HUNDRED FISTY AND 00//100 DOLLARS,” with “FOUN” (should be FOUR) and “FISTY” (should be FIFTY).
Per training data, 45% of fraud cases involve amount mismatches or alterations; misspellings are a strong tampering signal.
Numeric amount ($450.00) superficially matches, but OCR auto-correction hides manual alterations; raw text errors override model’s low fraud score.
Issuer (MoneyGram) and serial format appear valid; signature field is present and looks genuine, but written‐amount errors take priority.
actionable_recommendations: Do not accept or process this money order.
Consult issuer (MoneyGram) to verify serial number validity and issuance date.
Request the customer provide a correctly printed or reissued money order.

reasons: Raw OCR shows “FOUN HUNDRED FISTY…,” indicating multiple orthographic errors in the written amount line.
Such misspellings are strong evidence of manual tampering or counterfeit printing, per internal fraud patterns.
